events.message: The insured reported a car collision that occurred on March 9th. The vehicle sustained significant damage to the front bumper and headlights.
The claim was reviewed and categorised under Auto Accident due to the involvement of a personal vehicle in the reported incident.
A claims agent was assigned to manage the case and coordinate the next steps with the insured vehicle owner.
Official acknowledgment of the claim was sent to the claimant confirming receipt and outlining initial procedures.
Request was made for police report, photos of the vehicle damage, and repair estimates to support the claim investigation.
The claimant submitted all requested documentation including accident report, vehicle damage photos, and mechanicâ€™s estimate.
The investigative team began reviewing the submitted evidence to verify the circumstances and extent of the vehicle damage.
Investigation concluded confirming the collision was accidental and the damage claim is valid based on collected evidence.
A settlement amount was proposed to cover the vehicle repair costs as assessed by the authorized mechanic.
The claimant provided positive feedback acknowledging timely communication and clarity of the settlement terms.
The claim was officially approved following acceptance of the settlement proposal by all parties involved.
Payment was issued to the insured covering the agreed repair expenses for the damaged vehicle as per the claim.
The claim file was closed after confirming the repair was completed to the customer's satisfaction without further issues.
All claim documentation and communications were archived for record-keeping and future reference in compliance with policy.
